issue.title: polymorphic_allocator::allocate does not satisfy Cpp17Allocator requirements

discussion.p: With the adoption of P0593R6 in Prague, std::ptr::polymorphic_allocator no longer satisfies the of Cpp17Allocator requirements. Specifically, all calls to allocate(n) need to create an object for an array of n Ts (but not initialize any of those elements). std::pmr::polymorphic_allocator calls its underlying memory resource to allocate sufficient bytes of storage, but it does not create (and start the lifetime of) the array object within that storage.

resolution.p: This wording is relative to N4861.

blockquote.pre: [[nodiscard]] void* allocate(size_t bytes, size_t alignment = max_align);

blockquote.p: -2- Effects: Equivalent to: return do_allocate(bytes, alignment);

pre.ins: void* p = do_allocate(bytes, alignment); return launder(new (p) byte[bytes]);
